newsitem.title: ZAIRE: Opposition picks Mobutu foe as Zaire premier.
newsitem.headline: Opposition picks Mobutu foe as Zaire premier.

text.p: Zaire's bickering opposition said on Tuesday it had nominated an arch-foe of President Mobutu Sese Seko as the country's new prime minister.

After a week of bitter wrangling the USORAL opposition alliance voted overwhelmingly for the appointment of veteran politician Etienne Tshisekedi as replacement for prime minister Kengo wa Dondo, who resigned a week ago.
"We have just designated Mr Tshisekedi wa Malumba as prime minister," USORAL leader Frederic Kibassa told the pro-Mobutu presidential Movement in parliament.
Presidential Movement leader Idambituo Bakata indicated Mobutu would endorse the appointment of the man he earlier sacked as prime minister.
Tshisekedi has huge popular support in Zaire and has long favoured talks with rebels who have seized a quarter of Zaire since taking up arms last October.
